api_url.description: The API URL of the commercetools platform. https://docs.commercetools.com/http-api

client_id.description: The OAuth Client ID for a commercetools platform project. https://docs.commercetools.com/http-api-authorization

client_secret.description: The OAuth Client Secret for a commercetools platform project. https://docs.commercetools.com/http-api-authorization

project_key.description: The project key of commercetools platform project. https://docs.commercetools.com/getting-started

scopes.description: A list as string of OAuth scopes assigned to a project key, to access resources in a commercetools platform project. https://docs.commercetools.com/http-api-authorization

token_url.description: The authentication URL of the commercetools platform. https://docs.commercetools.com/http-api-authorization

block.description:
Create a new API client. Note that Commercetools might return slightly different scopes, resulting in a new API client being created everytime Terraform is run. In this case, fix your scopes accordingly to match what is returned by Commercetools.

Also see the [API client HTTP API documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com//http-api-projects-api-clients).

destination.description: [Destination](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/api-extensions#destination) Details where the extension can be reached

key.description: User-specific unique identifier for the extension

actions.description: Currently, Create and Update are supported

resource_type_id.description: Currently, cart, order, payment, and customer are supported

block.description: Array of [Trigger](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/api-extensions#trigger) Describes what triggers the extension

Create a new API extension to extend the bevahiour of an API with business logic. Note that API extensions affect the performance of the API it is extending. If it fails, the whole API call fails 

Also see the [API Extension API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/api-extensions)

is_active.description: Only active discount can be applied to the cart

key.description: User-specific unique identifier for a cart discount. Must be unique across a project

requires_discount_code.description: States whether the discount can only be used in a connection with a [DiscountCode](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/discountCodes#discountcode)

sort_order.description: The string must contain a number between 0 and 1. All matching cart discounts are applied to a cart in the order defined by this field. A discount with greater sort order is prioritized higher than a discount with lower sort order. The sort order is unambiguous among all cart discounts

stacking_mode.description: Specifies whether the application of this discount causes the following discounts to be ignored

target.description: Empty when the value has type giftLineItem, otherwise a [CartDiscountTarget](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/cartDiscounts#cartdiscounttarget)

distribution_channel_id.description: Gift Line Item discount specific field

product_id.description: Gift Line Item discount specific field

supply_channel_id.description: Gift Line Item discount specific field

variant.description: Gift Line Item discount specific field

cent_amount.description: The amount in cents (the smallest indivisible unit of the currency)

block.description: Absolute discount specific fields
Defines the effect the discount will have. [CartDiscountValue](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/cartDiscounts#cartdiscountvalue)

Cart discounts are used to change the prices of different elements within a cart.

See also the [Cart Discount API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/cartDiscounts)

key.description: Category-specific unique identifier. Must be unique across a project

order_hint.description: An attribute as base for a custom category order in one level, filled with random value when left empty

parent.description: A category that is the parent of this category in the category tree

slug.description: Human readable identifiers, needs to be unique

key.description: Optional User-defined identifier for the asset. Asset keys are unique inside their container (in this case the category)
Unique identifier, must be unique within the Asset

block.description: Array of AssetSource, Has at least one entry
Can be used to store images, icons or movies related to this category

Categories allow you to organize products into hierarchical structures.

Also see the [Categories HTTP API documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/categories).

key.description: Any arbitrary string key that uniquely identifies this channel within the project

roles.description: The [roles](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/channels#channelroleenum) of this channel. Each channel must have at least one role

name.description: The field name of a custom field (https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/channels#set-customfield)

value.description: The value of a custom field (https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/channels#set-customfield) expected as json encoded field to handle all different cases

block.description:
Channels represent a source or destination of different entities. They can be used to model warehouses or stores.

See also the [Channels API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/channels)

container.description: A namespace to group custom objects matching the pattern '[-_~.a-zA-Z0-9]+'

value.description: JSON types Number, String, Boolean, Array, Object

block.description:
Custom objects are a way to store arbitrary JSON-formatted data on the commercetools platform. It allows you to persist data that does not fit the standard data model. This frees your application completely from any third-party persistence solution and means that all your data stays on the commercetools platform.

See also the [Custom Object API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/custom-objects)

key.description: User-specific unique identifier for the customer group

block.description:
A Customer can be a member of a customer group (for example reseller, gold member). Special prices can be assigned to specific products based on a customer group.

See also the [Custome Group API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/customerGroups)

cart_discounts.description: The referenced matching cart discounts can be applied to the cart once the DiscountCode is added

code.description: Unique identifier of this discount code. This value is added to the cart to enable the related cart discounts in the cart

groups.description: The groups to which this discount code belong

max_applications.description: The discount code can only be applied maxApplications times

max_applications_per_customer.description: The discount code can only be applied maxApplicationsPerCustomer times per customer

valid_from.description: The time from which the discount can be applied on a cart. Before that time the code is invalid

valid_until.description: The time until the discount can be applied on a cart. After that time the code is invalid

block.description:
With discount codes it is possible to give specific cart discounts to an eligible set of users. They are defined by a string value which can be added to a cart so that specific cart discounts can be applied to the cart.

See also the [Discount Code Api Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/discountCodes)

key.description: User-specific unique identifier for the product type (max. 256 characters)

constraint.description: Describes how an attribute or a set of attributes should be validated across all variants of a product. See also [Attribute Constraint](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/productTypes#attributeconstraint-enum)

input_hint.description: Provides a visual representation type for this attribute. only relevant for text-based attribute types like TextType and LocalizableTextType

input_tip.description: Additional information about the attribute that aids content managers when setting product details

label.description: A human-readable label for the attribute

name.description:
The unique name of the attribute used in the API. The name must be between two and 256 characters long and can contain the ASCII letters A to Z in lowercase or uppercase, digits, underscores (_) and the hyphen-minus (-).
When using the same name for an attribute in two or more product types all fields of the AttributeDefinition of this attribute need to be the same across the product types, otherwise an AttributeDefinitionAlreadyExists error code will be returned. An exception to this are the values of an enum or lenum type and sets thereof

required.description: Whether the attribute is required to have a value

searchable.description: Whether the attribute's values should generally be activated in product search

block.description: [AttributeType](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/productTypes#attributetype)
[Product attribute fefinition](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/productTypes#attributedefinition)

Product types are used to describe common characteristics, most importantly common custom attributes, of many concrete products. Please note: to customize other resources than products, please refer to resource_type.

See also the [Product Type API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/productTypes)

countries.description: A two-digit country code as per [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)

currencies.description: A three-digit currency code as per [ISO 4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)

key.description: The unique key of the project

shipping_rate_input_type.description: Three ways to dynamically select a ShippingRatePriceTier exist. The CartValue type uses the sum of all line item prices, whereas CartClassification and CartScore use the shippingRateInput field on the cart to select a tier

block.description:
If shipping_rate_input_type is set to CartClassification these values are used to create tiers
. Only a key defined inside the values array can be used to create a tier, or to set a value for the shippingRateInput on the cart. The keys are checked for uniqueness and the request is rejected if keys are not unique

The project endpoint provides a limited set of information about settings and configuration of the project. Updating the settings is eventually consistent, it may take up to a minute before a change becomes fully active.

See also the [Project Settings API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/project)

is_default.description: One shipping method in a project can be default

key.description: User-specific unique identifier for the shipping method

predicate.description: A Cart predicate which can be used to more precisely select a shipping method for a cart

block.description:
With Shipping Methods you can specify which shipping services you want to provide to your customers for deliveries to different areas of the world at rates you can define.

See also the [Shipping Methods API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/shippingMethods)

key.description: User-specific unique identifier for a zone. Must be unique across a project

country.description: A two-digit country code as per [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)

block.description: [Location](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/zones#location)

cent_amount.description: The amount in cents (the smallest indivisible unit of the currency)

block.description: The shipping is free if the sum of the (custom) line item prices reaches the freeAbove value

minimum_cent_amount.description: If type is CartValue this represents the cent amount of the tier

score.description: If type is CartScore. Sets a fixed price for this score value

value.description: If type is CartClassification, must be a valid key of the CartClassification

block.description: The price of the score, value or minimum_cent_amount tier

A price tier is selected instead of the default price when a certain threshold or specific cart value is reached. If no tiered price is suitable for the cart, the base price of the shipping rate is used
. See also [Shipping Rate Price Tier API Docs](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/shippingMethods#shippingratepricetier)

Defines shipping rates (prices) for a specific zone.

See also [ZoneRate API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/shippingMethods#zonerate)

initial.description: A state can be declared as an initial state for any state machine. When a workflow starts, this first state must be an initial state

key.description: A unique identifier for the state

transitions.description:
Transitions are a way to describe possible transformations of the current state to other states of the same type (for example: Initial -> Shipped). When performing a transitionState update action and transitions is set, the currently referenced state must have a transition to the new state.
If transitions is an empty list, it means the current state is a final state and no further transitions are allowed.
If transitions is not set, the validation is turned off. When performing a transitionState update action, any other state of the same type can be transitioned to

block.description:
The commercetools platform allows you to model states of certain objects, such as orders, line items, products, reviews, and payments to define finite state machines reflecting the business logic you'd like to implement.

See also the [State API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/states)

distribution_channels.description: Set of ResourceIdentifier to a Channel with ProductDistribution

key.description: User-specific unique identifier for the store. The key is mandatory and immutable. It is used to reference the store

supply_channels.description: Set of ResourceIdentifier of Channels with InventorySupply

block.description:
Stores can be used to model, for example, physical retail locations, brand stores, or country-specific stores.

See also the [Stores API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/stores)

destination.description: The Message Queue into which the notifications are to be sentSee also the [Destination API Docs](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/subscriptions#destination)

format.description: The [format](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/subscriptions#format) in which the payload is delivered

key.description: User-specific unique identifier for the subscription

block.description: The change notifications subscribed to

types.description: types must contain valid message types for this resource, for example for resource type product the message type ProductPublished is valid. If no types of messages are given, the subscription is valid for all messages of this resource

block.description: The messages subscribed to

Subscriptions allow you to be notified of new messages or changes via a Message Queue of your choice. Subscriptions are used to trigger an asynchronous background process in response to an event on the commercetools platform. Common use cases include sending an Order Confirmation Email, charging a Credit Card after the delivery has been made, or synchronizing customer accounts to a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system.

See also the [Subscriptions API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/subscriptions)

key.description: User-specific unique identifier for the category

block.description:
Tax Categories define how products are to be taxed in different countries.

See also the [Tax Category API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/taxCategories)

amount.description: Number Percentage in the range of [0..1]. The sum of the amounts of all subRates, if there are any

country.description: A two-digit country code as per [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)

amount.description: Number Percentage in the range of [0..1]

block.description: For countries (for example the US) where the total tax is a combination of multiple taxes (for example state and local taxes)

Tax rate for Tax Category. 

See also [Tax Rate API Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/taxCategories#taxrate)

resource_type_ids.description: Defines for which [resources](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/custom-fields#customizable-resources) the type is valid

input_hint.description: [TextInputHint](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/types#textinputhint) Provides a visual representation type for this field. It is only relevant for string-based field types like StringType and LocalizedStringType

label.description: A human-readable label for the field

name.description:
The name of the field.
The name must be between two and 36 characters long and can contain the ASCII letters A to Z in lowercase or uppercase, digits, underscores (_) and the hyphen-minus (-).
The name must be unique for a given resource type ID. In case there is a field with the same name in another type it has to have the same FieldType also

required.description: Whether the field is required to have a value

block.description: Describes the [type](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/types#fieldtype) of the field
[Field definition](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/types#fielddefinition)

Types define custom fields that are used to enhance resources as you need. Use Types to model your own CustomFields on resources, like Category and Customer.

In case you want to customize products, please use product types instead that serve a similar purpose, but tailored to products.

See also the [Types Api Documentation](https://docs.commercetools.com/api/projects/types)
